answer_found_by_llm: The script uses package management commands (apt-get install, yum install) to install tools like openssl, curl, and wget. It also downloads files from 185.141.25.168 using curl and wget. The script attempts to delete logs with the command: rm -rf /var/log/yum*
The unusual file extension used for encrypted files is .¢ (a non-ASCII Unicode character).
The script contains the following encryption-related function names: encrypt_grep_files, encrypt_home, encrypt_root, encrypt_db, encrypt_ssh, and docker_stop_and_encrypt.
The script references the URL http://185.141.25.168/check_attack/0.txt to check for a text file on an external server.
